turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: DONNELLY
turns.text: That is for the urn.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Don't need it.  We're scattering the ashes.

turns.speaker: DONNELLY
turns.text: Yes, so we were informed.  However, we must of course transmit the remains to you in a receptacle.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: This is a hundred and eighty dollars.

turns.speaker: DONNELLY
turns.text: Yes sir.  It is our most modestly priced receptacle.

turns.speaker: DONNELLY
turns.text: They range up to three thousand.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yeah, but we're--

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: What the fuck is he talking about?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: My rug.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Fuckin' A.

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: And this guy peed on it.

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: His name is Lebowski?  That's your name, Dude!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah, this is the guy, this guy should compensate me for the fucking rug. I mean his wife goes out and owes money and they pee on my rug.

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: What do you mean, Dude?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Rug-peers did not do this.  I mean look at it.  Young trophy wife. Marries a guy for money but figures he isn't giving her enough.  She owes money all over town--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: I am the Walrus.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah, well, what do you care, Walter?

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: Yeah Dude, why is Walter so pissed off?

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: Sheesh.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter, how--

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: Where you going, Dude?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I'm going home, Donny.

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: Your phone's ringing, Dude.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Thank you, Donny.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Almost five!

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: I got eighteen dollars, Dude.

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: What tied the room together, Dude?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Were you listening to the story, Donny?

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: What--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Were you listening to the Dude's story?

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: I was bowling--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: So you have no frame of reference, Donny.  You're like a child who wanders in in the middle of a movie and wants to know--

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: Yeah Walter, what's your point?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: He peed on the Dude's rug--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: YOU'RE OUT OF YOUR ELEMENT!  This Chinaman is not the issue, Dude.

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: What's a pederast, Walter?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Shut the fuck up, Donny.

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: If what's during league play?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Life does not stop and start at your convenience, you miserable piece of shit.

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: What's wrong with Walter, Dude?

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: I am the Walrus.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: That fucking bitch!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Shut the fuck up, Donny!  V.I. Lenin! Vladimir Ilyich Ulyanov!

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: What the fuck is he talking about?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: That's fucking exactly what happened, Dude!  That makes me fucking SICK!

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: They posted the next round of the tournament--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Donny, shut the f--when do we play?

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: This Saturday.  Quintana and--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Saturday!  Well they'll have to reschedule.

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: Burkhalter.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I told that kraut a fucking thousand times I don't roll on shabbas.

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: It's already posted.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: WELL THEY CAN FUCKING UN-POST IT!

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: How come you don't roll on Saturday, Walter?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I'm shomer shabbas.

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: What's that, Walter?

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: Oh yeah, how'd it go?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Went alright.  Dude's car got a little dinged up--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Kill that poor woman.

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: Walter, if you can't ride in a car, how d'you get around on Shammas--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Really, Dude, you surprise me. They're not gonna kill shit.  They're not gonna do shit.  What can they do?  Fuckin' amateurs.  And meanwhile, look at the bottom line.  Who's sitting on a million fucking dollars? Am I wrong?

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: Who has your undies, Walter?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Where's your car, Dude?

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: And then they're gonna stamp on it?!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Oh for Christ--will you shut the fuck up, Donny.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Fucking Germans.  Nothing changes. Fucking Nazis.

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: They were Nazis, Dude?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Come on, Donny, they were threatening castration!

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Are you gonna split hairs?

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: No--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Am I wrong?

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: Well--

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: What do you need that for, Dude?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You gotta buck up, man, you can't go into the tournament with this negative attitude--

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: Those are good burgers, Walter.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Shut the fuck up, Donny.  This kid is in the ninth grade, Dude, and his father is--are you ready for this?-- Arthur Digby Sellers.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What have you.  We'll, uh--

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: We'll be near the In-and-Out Burger.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Shut the fuck up, Donny.  We'll, uh, brace the kid--he'll be a pushover. We'll get that fucking money, if he hasn't spent it already.  Million fucking clams. And yes, we'll be near the, uh--some burgers, some beers, a few laughs.  Our fucking troubles are over, Dude.

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: Who's in pyjamas, Walter?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Shut the fuck up, Donny.  Not a bunch of fig-eaters with towels on their heads tryin' to find reverse on a Soviet tank.  This is not a worthy--

turns.speaker: DONNY
turns.text: Are they gonna hurt us, Walter?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: They won't hurt us, Donny.  These men are cowards.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: --So he says, "My son can't hold a job, my daughter's married to a fuckin' loser, and I got a rash on my ass so bad I can't hardly siddown. But you know me.  I can't complain."

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Fuckin' A, man.  I got a rash. Fuckin' A, man.  I gotta tell ya Tony.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Jesus, man, can you change the station?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Fuck you man!  You don't like my fucking music, get your own fucking cab!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I've had a--

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: I pull over and kick your ass out, man!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: --had a rough night, and I hate the fucking Eagles, man--

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: That's it!  Outta this fucking cab!

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: And this is the study.  You can see the various commendations, honorary degrees, et cetera.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yes, uh, very impressive.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Please, feel free to inspect them.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I'm not really, uh.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Please!  Please!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: That's the key to the city of Pasadena, which Mr. Lebowski was given two years ago in recognition of his various civic, uh.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: That's a Los Angeles Chamber of Commerce Business Achiever award, which is given--not necessarily given every year!  Given only when there's a worthy, somebody especially--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Hey, is this him with Nancy?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: That is indeed Mr. Lebowski with the first lady, yes, taken when--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Lebowski on the right?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Of course, Mr. Lebowski on the right, Mrs.  Reagan on the left, taken when--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: He's handicapped, huh?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Mr. Lebowski is disabled, yes.  And this picture was taken when Mrs. Reagan was first lady of the nation, yes, yes? Not of California.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Far out.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: And in fact he met privately with the President, though unfortunately there wasn't time for a photo opportunity.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Nancy's pretty good.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Wonderful woman.  We were very--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Are these.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: These are Mr. Lebowski's children, so to speak--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Different mothers, huh?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: No, they--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I guess he's pretty, uh, racially pretty cool--

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: They're not his, heh-heh, they're not literally his children; they're the Little Lebowski Urban Achievers, inner-city children of promise but without the--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: --without  the means  for higher education, so Mr. Lebowski  has committed  to sending  all of them to college.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Jeez.  Think he's got room for one more?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: One--oh!  Heh-heh.  You never went to college?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well, yeah I did, but I spent most of my time occupying various, um, administration buildings--

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Heh-heh--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: --smoking thai-stick, breaking into the ROTC--

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Yes, heh--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: --and bowling.  I'll tell you the truth, Brandt, I don't remember most of it.--Jeez!  Fuck me!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: 1972 Pontiac LeBaron.

turns.speaker: YOUNGER COP
turns.text: Color?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Green.  Some brown, or, uh, rust, coloration.

turns.speaker: YOUNGER COP
turns.text: And was there anything of value in the car?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Huh?  Oh.  Yeah.  Tape deck.  Couple of Creedence tapes.  And there was a, uh. . . my briefcase.

turns.speaker: YOUNGER COP
turns.text: In the briefcase?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Papers.  Just papers.  You know, my papers.  Business papers.

turns.speaker: YOUNGER COP
turns.text: And what do you do, sir?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I'm unemployed.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: ...Me, I don't drink coffee.  But it's nice when they offer.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: ...Also, my rug was stolen.

turns.speaker: YOUNGER COP
turns.text: Your rug was in the car.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: No.  Here.

turns.speaker: YOUNGER COP
turns.text: Separate incidents?

turns.speaker: YOUNGER COP
turns.text: Sometimes.  I wouldn't hold out much hope for the tape deck though.  Or the Creedence tapes.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: And the, uh, the briefcase?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Ahh, not so good, man.

turns.speaker: THE STRANGER
turns.text: One a those days, huh.  Wal, a wiser fella than m'self once said, sometimes you eat the bar and sometimes the bar, wal, he eats you.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Uh-huh.  That some kind of Eastern thing?

turns.speaker: THE STRANGER
turns.text: Far from it.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Mm.

turns.speaker: THE STRANGER
turns.text: I like your style, Dude.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well I like your style too, man. Got a whole cowboy thing goin'.

turns.speaker: THE STRANGER
turns.text: Thankie. . . Just one thing, Dude. D'ya have to use s'many cuss words?

turns.speaker: THE STRANGER
turns.text: Take it easy, Dude.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah.  Thanks man.

turns.speaker: THE STRANGER
turns.text: Howdy do, Dude.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Oh, hey man, how are ya?  I wondered if I'd see you again.

turns.speaker: THE STRANGER
turns.text: Wouldn't miss the semis.  How things been goin'?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Ahh, you know.  Strikes and gutters, ups and downs.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Thanks, Gary...Take care, man, I gotta get back.

turns.speaker: THE STRANGER
turns.text: Sure.  Take it easy, Dude--I know that you will.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah man.  Well, you know, the Dude abides.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: This is quite a pad you got here, man.  Completely unspoiled.

turns.speaker: TREEHORN
turns.text: What's your drink, Dude?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: White Russian, thanks.  How's the smut business, Jackie?

turns.speaker: TREEHORN
turns.text: I wouldn't know, Dude.  I deal in publishing, entertainment, political advocacy, and--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Which one was Logjammin'?

turns.speaker: TREEHORN
turns.text: Regrettably, it's true, standards have fallen in adult entertainment. It's video, Dude.  Now that we're competing with the amateurs, we can't afford to invest that little extra in story, production value, feeling.

turns.speaker: TREEHORN
turns.text: People forget that the brain is the biggest erogenous zone--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: On you, maybe.

turns.speaker: TREEHORN
turns.text: Of course, you do get the good with the bad.  The new technology permits us to do exciting things with interactive erotic software.  Wave of the future, Dude.  100% electronic.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Uh-huh.  Well, I still jerk off manually.

turns.speaker: TREEHORN
turns.text: Of course you do.  I can see you're anxious for me to get to the point. Well Dude, here it is.  Where's Bunny?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I thought you might know, man.

turns.speaker: TREEHORN
turns.text: Me?  How would I know?  The only reason she ran off was to get away from her rather sizable debt to me.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: But she hasn't run off, she's been--

turns.speaker: TREEHORN
turns.text: I've heard the kidnapping story, so save it.  I know you're mixed up in all this, Dude, and I don't care what you're trying to take off her husband.  That's your business.  All I'm saying is, I want mine.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah, well, right man, there are many facets to this, uh, you know, many interested parties.  If I can find your money, man-- what's in it for the Dude?

turns.speaker: TREEHORN
turns.text: Of course, there's that to discuss. Refill?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Does the Pope shit in the woods?

turns.speaker: TREEHORN
turns.text: Let's say a 10% finder's fee?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Okay, Jackie, done.  I like the way you do business.  Your money is being held by a kid named Larry Sellers. He lives in North Hollywood, on Radford, near the In-and-Out Burger. A real fuckin' brat, but I'm sure your goons'll be able to get it off him, mean he's only fifteen and he's flunking social studies.  So if you'll just write me a check for my ten per cent. . . of half a million. . . fifty grand.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: No!  No!  NO!  THAT'S NOT--

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I FUCKEEN KILL JOR FUCKEEN CAR!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Who the fuck are you, man!  Come on, man!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Relax, man!  No physical harm intended!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Who the fuck are you?  Why've you been following me?  Come on, fuckhead!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Hey, relax man, I'm a brother shamus.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Brother Shamus?  Like an Irish monk?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Irish m--What the fuck are you talking about?  My name's Da Fino!  I'm a private snoop!  Like you, man!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Hello, gentlemen.  You are the bereaved?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah man.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Francis Donnelly.  Pleased to meet you.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Jeffrey Lebowski.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Is that what that's a picture of?

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: In a sense, yes.  Elfranco, my robe. My art has been commended as being strongly vaginal.  Which bothers some men.  The word itself makes some men uncomfortable.  Vagina.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Oh yeah?

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Yes, they don't like hearing it and find it difficult to say.  Whereas without batting an eye a man will refer to his "dick" or his "rod" or his "Johnson".

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: "Johnson"?

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Yes, I know about it.  And I know that you acted as courier.  And let me tell you something:  the whole thing stinks to high heaven.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Right, but let me explain something about that rug--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Do you like sex, Mr. Lebowski?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Sex.  The physical act of love. Coitus.  Do you like it?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I was talking about my rug.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: You're not interested in sex?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: You mean coitus?

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: I like it too.  It's a male myth about feminists that we hate sex. It can be a natural, zesty enterprise. But unfortunately there are some people--it is called satyriasis in men, nymphomania in women--who engage in it compulsively and without joy.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Oh, no.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Yes Mr. Lebowski, these unfortunate souls cannot love in the true sense of the word.  Our mutual acquaintance Bunny is one of these.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Listen, Maude, I'm sorry if your stepmother is a nympho, but I don't see what it has to do with--do you have any kalhua?

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Take a look at this, sir.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Lord.  You can imagine where it goes from here.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: He fixes the cable?

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Don't be fatuous, Jeffrey.  Little matter to me that this woman chose to pursue a career

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Shit yeah, the achievers.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Little Lebowski Urban Achievers, yes, and proud we are of all of them. I asked my father about his withdrawal of a million dollars from the Foundation account and he told me about this "abduction", but I tell you it is preposterous.  This compulsive

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah, but my-

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: I'm getting to your rug. My  father and I don't get along; he doesn't approve of my lifestyle and, needless to say, I don't approve of his. Still, I hardly wish to make my father's embezzlement a police matter, so I'm proposing that you try to recover the money from the people you delivered it to.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well--sure, I could do that--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: If you successfully do so, I will compensate you to the tune of 1% of the recovered sum.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: A hundred.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Thousand, yes, bones or clams or whatever you call them.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah, but what about--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: --your rug, yes, well with that money you can buy any number of rugs that don't have sentimental value for me. And I am sorry about that crack on the jaw.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Oh that's okay, I hardly even--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Here's the name and number of a doctor who will look at it for you.  You will receive no bill.  He's a good man, and thorough.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: That's really thoughtful but I--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Please see him, Jeffrey.  He's a good man, and thorough.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Jeffrey, you haven't gone to the doctor.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: No it's fine, really, uh--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Do you have any news regarding my father's money?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I, uh... money, yeah, I gotta respecfully, 69 you know, tender my resignation on that matter, 'cause it looks like your mother really was kidnapped after all.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: She most certainly was not!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Hey man, why don't you fucking listen occasionally?  You might learn something.  Now I got--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: And please don't call her my mother.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Now I got--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: She is most definitely the perpetrator and not the victim.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I'm telling you, I got definitive evidence--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: From who?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: The main guy, Dieter--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Dieter Hauff?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well--yeah, I guess--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Her "co-star" in the beaver picture?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Beaver?  You mean vagina?--I mean, you know him?

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Dieter has been on the fringes of-- well, of everything in L.A., for about twenty years.  Look at my LP's. Under 'Autobahn.'

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Roy Orbison. . . Pink Floyd.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Huh?  Autobahn.  A-u-t-o.  Their music is a sort of--ugh--techno-pop.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Jeez.  I miss vinyl.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Is he pretending to be the abductor?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well...yeah--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Look, Jeffrey, you don't really kidnap someone that you're acquainted with.  You can't get away with it if the hostage knows who you are.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well yeah...I know that.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: So Dieter has the money?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well, no, not exactly.  It's a complicated case, Maude.  Lotta ins. Lotta outs.  And a lotta strands to keep in my head, man.  Lotta strands in old Duder's--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Do you still have that doctor's number?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Huh?  No, really, I don't even have the bruise any more, I--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Please Jeffrey.  I don't want to be responsible for any delayed after- effects.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Delayed after-eff--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: I want you to see him immediately.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Jeffrey.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Maude?

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Tell me a little about yourself, Jeffrey.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well, uh. . . Not much to tell.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I was, uh, one of the authors of the Port Huron Statement.--The original Port Huron Statement.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Not the compromised second draft. And then I, uh. . . Ever hear of the Seattle Seven?

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Mmnun.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: And then. . . let's see, I uh--music business briefly.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Oh?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah.  Roadie for Metallica.  Speed of Sound Tour.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Bunch of assholes.  And then, you know, little of this, little of that. My career's, uh, slowed down a bit lately.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: What do you do for fun?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Oh, you know, the usual.  Bowl. Drive around.  The occasional acid flashback.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: What happened to your house?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Jackie Treehorn trashed the place. Wanted to save the finder's fee.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Finder's fee?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: He thought I had your father's money, so he got me out of the way while he looked for it.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: It's not my father's money, it's the Foundation's.  Why did he think you had it?  And who does?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Larry Sellers, a high-school kid. Real fucking brat.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Jeffrey--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: It's a complicated case, Maude. Lotta ins, lotta outs.  Fortunately I've been adhering to a pretty strict, uh, drug regimen to keep my mind, you know, limber.  I'm real fucking close to your father's money, real fucking close.  It's just--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: I keep telling you, it's the Foundation's money.  Father doesn't have any.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Huh?  He's fucking loaded.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: No no, the wealth was all Mother's.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: But your father--he runs stuff, he--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: We did let Father run one of the companies, briefly, but he didn't do very well at it.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: But he's--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: He helps administer the charities now, and I give him a reasonable allowance.  He has no money of his own.  I know how he likes to present himself; Father's weakness is vanity. Hence the slut.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Huh.  Jeez.  Well, so, did he--is that yoga?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Increases?

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Well yes, what did you think this was all about?  Fun and games?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well...no, of course not--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: I want a child.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah, okay, but see, the Dude--

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Look, Jeffrey, I don't want a partner. In fact I don't want the father to be someone I have to see socially, or who'll have any interest in rearing the child himself.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Huh...

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: So...that doctor.

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: Exactly.  What happened to your face? Did Jackie Treehorn do that as well?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: No, the, uh, police chief of Malibu. A real reactionary. . . So your father. . . Oh man, I get it!

turns.speaker: MAUDE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: This was, uh--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah man, it really tied the room together--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: This was a valued, uh.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: What's your point, Walter?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: There's no fucking reason--here's my point, Dude--there's no fucking reason--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: What's the point of--we all know who was at fault, so what the fuck are you talking about?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Huh?  No!  What the fuck are you talking--I'm not--we're talking about unchecked aggression here--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Forget it, Donny.  You're out of your element.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: This Chinaman who peed on my rug, I can't go give him a bill so what the fuck are you talking about?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What the fuck are you talking about?! This Chinaman is not the issue!  I'm talking about drawing a line in the sand, Dude.  Across this line you do not, uh--and also, Dude, Chinaman is not the preferred, uh. . . Asian- American.  Please.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter, this is not a guy who built the rail- roads, here, this is a guy who peed on my--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What the fuck are you--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter, he peed on my rug--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: So who--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Jeff Lebowski.  Come on.  This other Jeffrey Lebowski.  The millionaire. He's gonna be easier to find anyway than these two, uh. these two  . . . And he has the wealth, uh, the resources obviously, and there is no reason, no FUCKING reason, why his wife should go out and owe money and they pee on your rug.  Am I wrong?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: No, but--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Am I wrong!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah, but--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Okay. That, uh.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Donny!  Please!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah, I could find this Lebowski guy--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Way to go, Dude.  If you will it, it is no dream.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: You're fucking twenty minutes late. What the fuck is that?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Theodore Herzel.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: State of Israel.  If you will it, Dude, it is no--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: What the fuck're you talking about? The carrier.  What's in the fucking carrier?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Huh?  Oh--Cynthia's Pomeranian. Can't leave him home alone or he eats the furniture.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: What the fuck are you--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I'm saying, Cynthia's Pomeranian. I'm looking after it while Cynthia and Marty Ackerman are in Hawaii.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: You brought a fucking Pomeranian bowling?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What do you mean "brought it bowling"? I didn't rent it shoes.  I'm not buying it a fucking beer.  He's not gonna take your fucking turn, Dude.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Hey, man, if my fucking ex-wife asked me to take care of her fucking dog while she and her boyfriend went to Honolulu, I'd tell her to go fuck herself.  Why can't she board it?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: First of all, Dude, you don't have an ex, secondly, it's a fucking show dog with fucking papers.  You can't board it.  It gets upset, its hair falls out.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Hey man--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Fucking dog has papers, Dude.--Over the line!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Come on Walter, it's just--it's Smokey.  So his toe slipped over a little, it's just a game.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: This is a league game.  This determines who enters the next round- robin, am I wrong?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Smokey my friend, you're entering a world of pain.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Hey Walter--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Mark that frame an eight, you're entering a world of pain.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter, they're calling the cops, put the piece away.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: MARK IT ZERO!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter, you can't do that.  These guys're like me, they're pacificists. Smokey was a conscientious objector.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You know Dude, I myself dabbled with pacifism at one point.  Not in Nam, of course--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: And you know Smokey has emotional problems!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You mean--beyond pacifism?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: He's fragile, man!  He's very fragile!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Huh.  I did not know that.  Well, it's water under the bridge.  And we do enter the next round-robin, am I wrong?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: No, you're not wrong--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Am I wrong!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: You're not wrong, Walter, you're just an asshole.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Okay then.  We play Quintana and O'Brien next week.  They'll be pushovers.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Just, just take it easy, Walter.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: That's your answer to everything, Dude.  And let me point out--pacifism is not--look at our current situation with that camelfucker in Iraq-- pacifism is not something to hide behind.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Well, just take 't easy, man.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I'm perfectly calm, Dude.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah?  Wavin' a gun around?!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Calmer than you are.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yeah, but he's a fucking pervert, Dude.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: The man is a sex offender.  With a record.  Spent six months in Chino for exposing himself to an eight- year-old.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Huh.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: When he moved down to Venice he had to go door-to-door to tell everyone he's a pederast.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Anyway.  How much they offer you?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Twenty grand.  And of course I still keep the rug.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Just for making the hand-off?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: ...They  gave  Dude  a  beeper,  so whenever these guys call--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What if it's during a game?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I told him if it was during league play--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I figure it's easy money, it's all pretty harmless.  I mean she probably kidnapped herself.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: That...fucking...bitch!

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: It's all a goddamn fake.  Like Lenin said, look for the person who will benefit.  And you will, uh, you know, you'll, uh, you know what I'm trying to say--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Those rich fucks!  This whole fucking thing-- I did not watch my buddies die face down in the muck so that this fucking strumpet--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: I don't see any connection to Vietnam, Walter.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Well, there isn't a literal connection, Dude.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter, face it, there isn't any connection.  It's your roll.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Have it your way.  The point is--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: It's your roll--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: The fucking point is--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: It's your roll.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: The what?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: The ringer!  The ringer, Dude!  Have they called yet?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: What the hell is this?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: My dirty undies.  Laundry, Dude. The whites.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Agh--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter, I'm sure there's a reason you brought your dirty undies--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Thaaaat's right, Dude.  The weight. The ringer can't look empty.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Walter--what the fuck are you thinking?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Well you're right, Dude, I got to thinking.  I got to thinking why should we settle for a measly fucking twenty grand--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: We?  What the fuck we?  You said you just wanted to come along--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: My point, Dude, is why should we settle for twenty grand when we can keep the entire million.  Am I wrong?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yes you're wrong.  This isn't a fucking game, Walter--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: It is a fucking game.  You said so yourself, Dude--she kidnapped herself--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Oh shit.  Walter.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What the fuck is going on there?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: They hung up, Walter!  You fucked it up!  You fucked it up!  Her life was in our hands!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Easy, Dude.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: We're screwed now!  We don't get shit and they're gonna kill her! We're fucked, Walter!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Dude, nothing is fucked.  Come on. You're being very unDude.  They'll call back.  Look, she kidnapped her--

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Ya see?  Nothing is fucked up here, Dude.  Nothing is fucked.  These guys are fucking amateurs--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Shutup, Walter!  Don't fucking say peep when I'm doing business here.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Okay Dude.  Have it your way.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yeah.  So as long as we get her back, nobody's in a position to complain. And we keep the baksheesh.

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Terrific, Walter.  But you haven't told me how we get her back.  Where is she?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: That's the simple part, Dude.  When we make the handoff, I grab the guy and beat  it out of him.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: ...Huh?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: Yeah.  That's a great plan, Walter. That's fucking ingenious, if I understand it correctly.  That's a Swiss fucking watch.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Thaaat's right, Dude.  The beauty of this is its simplicity. If the plan gets too complex something always goes wrong.  If there's one thing I learned in Nam--

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: FUCK.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What'd he say?  Where's the hand- off?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: There is no fucking hand-off, Walter! At a wooden bridge we throw the money out  of the car!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: DUDE
turns.text: We throw the money out of the moving car!
